newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Westfield aims to maintain payout.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Westfield aims to maintain payout.

text.p: Property group Westfield Trust said on Thursday it expected a distribution level in 1997 of at least the 19.6 cents per unit level achieved in 1996.
The shopping centre operator said earlier that its net profit for calendar 1996 rose 18.7 percent to A$222.7 million.
Total distribution to unit holders was increased to 19.6 cents per unit from 19.21.

Property income rose 27.4 percent for the year to A$250.2 million from A$196.4 million in 1995 mainly as a result of acquisitions, the first full year of trading in new or redeveloped centres at Parramatta, Indooroopilly and Tuggerah and increased returns from the existing portfolio.
Total sales for the trust's 28 shopping centres rose 25 percent to A$6 billion from A$4.8 billion.

"The increase on a comparable basis was 2.2 percent, with the generally subdued fashion trade offset by stronger performances in food, leisure and entertainment, services and general retail," the trust said in a statement.
The vacancy rate across the portfolio remained steady at less than one percent.
Executive director Steven Lowy said profit and distribution were in line with expectations.
During the year, the trust invested a total of A$750 million.
Lowy said the trust now also had 15 multi-plex cinemas across its portfolio and is planning another eight.
"...Barring any unforeseen circumstances, distributions in 1997 should at least be maintained at the present level," he said in a statement accompanying the results.
